references.paper_title: Do as i can, not as i say: Grounding language in robotic affordances
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the work presented in the current paper because it introduces the concept of grounding language in robotic affordances, a critical component of embodied instruction following.

references.paper_title: SayCanPay: Heuristic Planning with Large Language Models using Learnable Domain Knowledge
references.reason: This paper enhances the capabilities of LLMs by incorporating learnable domain knowledge which improves the performance of embodied instruction following.

references.paper_title: Progprompt: Generating situated robot task plans using large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces ProgPrompt, a novel framework for generating situated robot task plans using large language models, which improves planning efficiency and effectiveness for embodied AI.

references.paper_title: Leveraging pre-trained large language models to construct and utilize world models for model-based task planning
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the use of pre-trained LLMs to build world models for model-based task planning, improving the overall performance of embodied AI systems.

references.paper_title: Language models as zero-shot planners: Extracting actionable knowledge for embodied agents
references.reason: This paper explores the use of language models as zero-shot planners for embodied agents, which addresses a similar challenge as the current paper but with a different approach.
